item.dc:creator: @xray_veeo xray veeo
item.description:
@xray_veeo wrote:

Darkning:

ok…i added the public ints you said but i still get errors. How would i make my own?

read java coding conventions, download sources, study codes, just take a few days and try, methods are hard honestly, but if you just try for more then 5 minutes, youll start putting the pieces together, and youll start learning how to code better.

Press any key to continue . . .[code][/code][/quote]
those are ALL variable errors.

public int lastKill = 0;
public int Killcount = 0;
public int otherpkps = 0;
public int otherkillc = 0;
public int deathcount = 0;

try adding those.though im not sure if itll work, i think you gotta make ur own methods.
[br][br][size=1]Posted on: February 06, 2009, 10:13:28 am[/size][hr][quote=“The Reaper X, post:19, topic:260646”]You’re putting methods from a czar source into a dodian. Delta doesn’t have calls for “killcount” or “lastkill”, etc. You’re going to have to make them yourself.[/quote]
yea, hes right, what i did will give you no errors, but it wont work.

item.title: Adding pk points
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

You’re putting methods from a czar source into a dodian. Delta doesn’t have calls for “killcount” or “lastkill”, etc. You’re going to have to make them yourself.

item.dc:creator: @xray_veeo xray veeo
item.description:
@xray_veeo wrote:

[quote=“Darkning, post:1, topic:260646”]NOTE: I am using a deltascape based source.

i added

public void checkPKReward() { if (pkpoints == 500000) { addItem(1038, 1); sendMessage( "Congratz on getting " + pkpoints + " pk points! Have a phat =)"); } if (pkpoints == 750000) { addItem(1040, 1); sendMessage( "Congratz on getting " + pkpoints + " pk points! Have a phat =)"); } if (pkpoints == 100000) { addItem(1042, 1); sendMessage( "Congratz on getting " + pkpoints + " pk points! Have a phat =)"); } if (pkpoints == 150000) { addItem(1044, 1); sendMessage( "Congratz on getting " + pkpoints + " pk points! Have a phat =)"); } if (pkpoints == 200000) { addItem(1046, 1); sendMessage( "Congratz on getting " + pkpoints + " pk points! Have a phat =)"); } if (pkpoints == 300000) { addItem(1048, 1); sendMessage( "Congratz on getting " + pkpoints + " pk points! Have a phat =)"); } if (pkpoints == 500000) { addItem(6570, 1); sendMessage( "Congratz on getting " + pkpoints + " pk points! Have a firecape =)"); } }

underneath:

[code]public void getTotalXP() {
if(playerRights >= 2)
return;
int a0 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[0]);
int a1 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[1]);

int b21 = getXPForLevel(a21);

totalXP = b1+b2+b3+b4+b5+b6+b7+b8+b9+b10+b11+b12+b13+b14+b15+b16+b17+b18+b19+b20+b21;
}
public int hlevel = 0;
public boolean onlyxp = false;
public int total = 0;
public int totalXP = 0;
public void resetKnight(){
if(q9 == 3 || q9 == 4){
q9 = 2;
sM(“Your knight kills have been reset.”);
}
}[/code]

then i added:

if (command.startsWith("mypk") && playerRights >= 0) { sendMessage( "Your current pk points are - " + pkpoints + ", keep pking!"); }

i put this as the first command, it is under:

private void customCommand(String command) {

then i added

[code]public void PKz() {
if (PlayerHandler.players[KillerId] != null) {
if (KillerId != playerId) {
if (PlayerHandler.players[KillerId].combat > combat) {
lnew = 1;
} else if (PlayerHandler.players[KillerId].combat < combat) {
lnew = 3;
} else if (PlayerHandler.players[KillerId].combat == combat) {
lnew = 2;
}
client killerz = (client) server.playerHandler.players[KillerId];

            if (killerz != null) {
                boolean givePoints = true;

                if (killerz.lastKill.equalsIgnoreCase(playerName)) {
                    killerz.sendMessage(
                            "You recieve no pk points as you have pked "
                                    + playerName + " twice in a row");
                    givePoints = false;
                }
                if (givePoints) {
                    PlayerHandler.players[KillerId].pkpoints += lnew;
                    PlayerHandler.players[KillerId].killcount += 1;
                    otherpkps = PlayerHandler.players[KillerId].pkpoints;
                    otherkillc = PlayerHandler.players[KillerId].killcount;
                    killerz.sendMessage(
                            "You recieve " + lnew
                            + " player-kill, you now have " + otherpkps
                            + " player-kill points.");
                    killerz.sendMessage(
                            "You now have a total of " + otherkillc
                            + " player kills.");  
                    killerz.checkPKReward();
                    killerz.lastKill = playerName;
                    server.playerHandler.messageToAll = killerz.playerName
                            + " has killed " + playerName + ", "
                            + killerz.playerName + " now has "
                            + killerz.pkpoints + " pk points and "
                            + killerz.killcount + " kills!";
                }
            }
        }
        deathcount = +1;
    }
}[/code]

i put this after:

public void robfail() { EntangleDelay = 10; }

i compiled and got 33 errors.

^ client.java:16614: cannot find symbol symbol : variable lnew location: class client lnew = 1; ^ client.java:16616: cannot find symbol symbol : variable lnew location: class client lnew = 3; ^ client.java:16618: cannot find symbol symbol : variable lnew location: class client lnew = 2; ^ client.java:16625: cannot find symbol symbol : variable lastKill location: class client if (killerz.lastKill.equalsIgnoreCase(playerName)) { ^ client.java:16632: cannot find symbol symbol : variable pkpoints location: class Player PlayerHandler.players[KillerId].pkpoints += lnew; ^ client.java:16632: cannot find symbol symbol : variable lnew location: class client PlayerHandler.players[KillerId].pkpoints += lnew; ^ client.java:16633: cannot find symbol symbol : variable killcount location: class Player PlayerHandler.players[KillerId].killcount += 1; ^ client.java:16634: cannot find symbol symbol : variable otherpkps location: class client otherpkps = PlayerHandler.players[KillerId].pkpoints; ^ client.java:16634: cannot find symbol symbol : variable pkpoints location: class Player otherpkps = PlayerHandler.players[KillerId].pkpoints; ^ client.java:16635: cannot find symbol symbol : variable otherkillc location: class client otherkillc = PlayerHandler.players[KillerId].killcount; ^ client.java:16635: cannot find symbol symbol : variable killcount location: class Player otherkillc = PlayerHandler.players[KillerId].killcount; ^ client.java:16637: cannot find symbol symbol : variable lnew location: class client "You recieve " + lnew ^ client.java:16638: cannot find symbol symbol : variable otherpkps location: class client + " player-kill, you now have " + otherpkps ^ client.java:16641: cannot find symbol symbol : variable otherkillc location: class client "You now have a total of " + otherkillc ^ client.java:16644: cannot find symbol symbol : variable lastKill location: class client killerz.lastKill = playerName; ^ client.java:16648: cannot find symbol symbol : variable pkpoints location: class client + killerz.pkpoints + " pk points and " ^ client.java:16649: cannot find symbol symbol : variable killcount location: class client + killerz.killcount + " kills!"; ^ client.java:16653: cannot find symbol symbol : variable deathcount location: class client deathcount = +1; ^ 33 errors Finished ! item.title: Adding pk points
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

[quote=“Digital Hotdogs, post:7, topic:260646”][quote author=The Reaper X link=topic=344197.msg2656802#msg2656802 date=1233931857]

[quote author=Digital Hotdogs link=topic=344197.msg2656796#msg2656796 date=1233931617]

[quote author=The Reaper X link=topic=344197.msg2656794#msg2656794 date=1233931554]
Oh, i see now. Well, you’re trying to call for pkpoints when no such thing exists. You have to make an int to save for the player called “pkpoints”. Idk how that works on delta, considering i haven’t touched that damn thing. Does delta have a moreinfo folder?
[/quote]No Delta does not.
[/quote]It would be a lot easier to explain if it did. Ugh, i guess I’m going to be downloaded delta. Give me a few more minutes.
[/quote]Haha it’s not that hard actually. Kihomura while he was making his Black Knight System, he told me a few codes on MSN. I kinda leeched them

*Worked off it.[/quote]I’m just used to Czar, not Dodian. (What delta uses)

Well anyways, you’re going to have to make an int writable in the char folder for each character file. To do this, all you really have to do is copy something like “starter” change it to pkpoints.

So search for:

					} else if (token.equals("character-starter")) {
						starter = Integer.parseInt(token2);

copy it and paste it below it. “character-starter” is what is written in the character file. starter in the second line is the integer being used to be placed in the character file after the words “character-starter”. You know how the starter works right? After someone uses is, you can look in their file and their starter will change from 0 to 1. Well, you’re going to do the same thing, but with pkpoints.

After you’ve copied those two lines and pasted it below it, remember to change the "starter"s to “pkpoints”. So it looks like this:

					} else if (token.equals("character-starter")) {
						starter = Integer.parseInt(token2);
					} else if (token.equals("character-pkpoints")) {
						pkpoints = Integer.parseInt(token2);

After you’ve done this, search for starter again, or hit next going down using the Ctrl+F tool. You should find something like this:

			characterfile.write("character-starter = ", 0, 20);
			characterfile.write(Integer.toString(starter), 0, Integer.toString(starter).length());
			characterfile.newLine();

Once again, copy and paste the same thing below it and change the "starter"s to “pkpoints”. This is what actually writes it into the character file. Now this is important. Notice how there is a 20 there? Well count the letters in 'character-starter = ’ from the first quote to the last. There are 20 keys there. 20 is a form of a substring, so it knows where to put the number of pkpoints you have. So once you’ve changed starter to pkpoints, you’re going to have to count to see how many letters and spaces and everything are there and put that number where the 20 was originally.

Now after you’ve done all this, be sure to save your client.java. Now open your Player.java. Search for “public int starter;”. Under that, do “public int pkpoints”. Save your player.java. If you’ve done everything i told you, all you have to do now is compile and it should all work.

Tell me if you have any problems and ill be sure to help.

Read full topic

item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

Give me a few minutes to look over this and I’ll try to figure out what you did wrong. I’ve only read about half, and I noticed that there are a few things that you added that you didn’t even have to.

This

[code]public void getTotalXP() {
if(playerRights >= 2)
return;
int a0 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[0]);
int a1 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[1]);
int a2 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[2]);
int a3 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[3]);
int a4 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[4]);
int a5 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[5]);

int a7 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[7]);

int a21 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[21]);
int b0 = getXPForLevel(a0);
int b1 = getXPForLevel(a1);

int b3 = getXPForLevel(a3);
int b4 = getXPForLevel(a4);
int b5 = getXPForLevel(a5);

int b7 = getXPForLevel(a7);
int b8 = getXPForLevel(a8);
int b9 = getXPForLevel(a9);
int b10 = getXPForLevel(a10);
int b11 = getXPForLevel(a11);
int b12 = getXPForLevel(a12);
int b13 = getXPForLevel(a13);
int b14 = getXPForLevel(a14);
int b15 = getXPForLevel(a15);

int b17 = getXPForLevel(a17);
int b18 = getXPForLevel(a18);
int b19 = getXPForLevel(a19);
int b20 = getXPForLevel(a20);
int b21 = getXPForLevel(a21);

totalXP = b1+b2+b3+b4+b5+b6+b7+b8+b9+b10+b11+b12+b13+b14+b15+b16+b17+b18+b19+b20+b21;
}
public int hlevel = 0;
public boolean onlyxp = false;
public int total = 0;
public int totalXP = 0;
public void resetKnight(){
if(q9 == 3 || q9 == 4){
q9 = 2;
sM(“Your knight kills have been reset.”);
}
}[/code]

and this

public void robfail() { EntangleDelay = 10; }

Has nothing to do with a pkpoint system.

Read full topic

item.title: Adding pk points
item.dc:creator: @Darkning Darkning
item.description:
@Darkning wrote:

NOTE: I am using a deltascape based source.

i added

public void checkPKReward() { if (pkpoints == 500000) { addItem(1038, 1); sendMessage( "Congratz on getting " + pkpoints + " pk points! Have a phat =)"); } if (pkpoints == 750000) { addItem(1040, 1); sendMessage( "Congratz on getting " + pkpoints + " pk points! Have a phat =)"); } if (pkpoints == 100000) { addItem(1042, 1); sendMessage( "Congratz on getting " + pkpoints + " pk points! Have a phat =)"); } if (pkpoints == 150000) { addItem(1044, 1); sendMessage( "Congratz on getting " + pkpoints + " pk points! Have a phat =)"); } if (pkpoints == 200000) { addItem(1046, 1); sendMessage( "Congratz on getting " + pkpoints + " pk points! Have a phat =)"); } if (pkpoints == 300000) { addItem(1048, 1); sendMessage( "Congratz on getting " + pkpoints + " pk points! Have a phat =)"); } if (pkpoints == 500000) { addItem(6570, 1); sendMessage( "Congratz on getting " + pkpoints + " pk points! Have a firecape =)"); } }

underneath:

[code]public void getTotalXP() {
if(playerRights >= 2)
return;
int a0 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[0]);
int a1 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[1]);
int a2 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[2]);
int a3 = getLevelForXP(playerXP[3]);

int b4 = getXPForLevel(a4);

totalXP = b1+b2+b3+b4+b5+b6+b7+b8+b9+b10+b11+b12+b13+b14+b15+b16+b17+b18+b19+b20+b21;
}
public int hlevel = 0;
public boolean onlyxp = false;
public int total = 0;
public int totalXP = 0;
public void resetKnight(){
if(q9 == 3 || q9 == 4){
q9 = 2;
sM(“Your knight kills have been reset.”);
}
}[/code]

then i added:

if (command.startsWith("mypk") && playerRights >= 0) { sendMessage( "Your current pk points are - " + pkpoints + ", keep pking!"); }

i put this as the first command, it is under:

private void customCommand(String command) {

then i added

[code]public void PKz() {
if (PlayerHandler.players[KillerId] != null) {
if (KillerId != playerId) {
if (PlayerHandler.players[KillerId].combat > combat) {
lnew = 1;
} else if (PlayerHandler.players[KillerId].combat < combat) {
lnew = 3;
} else if (PlayerHandler.players[KillerId].combat == combat) {
lnew = 2;
}
client killerz = (client) server.playerHandler.players[KillerId];

            if (killerz != null) {
                boolean givePoints = true;

                if (killerz.lastKill.equalsIgnoreCase(playerName)) {
                    killerz.sendMessage(
                            "You recieve no pk points as you have pked "
                                    + playerName + " twice in a row");
                    givePoints = false;
                }
                if (givePoints) {
                    PlayerHandler.players[KillerId].pkpoints += lnew;
                    PlayerHandler.players[KillerId].killcount += 1;
                    otherpkps = PlayerHandler.players[KillerId].pkpoints;
                    otherkillc = PlayerHandler.players[KillerId].killcount;
                    killerz.sendMessage(
                            "You recieve " + lnew
                            + " player-kill, you now have " + otherpkps
                            + " player-kill points.");
                    killerz.sendMessage(
                            "You now have a total of " + otherkillc
                            + " player kills.");  
                    killerz.checkPKReward();
                    killerz.lastKill = playerName;
                    server.playerHandler.messageToAll = killerz.playerName
                            + " has killed " + playerName + ", "
                            + killerz.playerName + " now has "
                            + killerz.pkpoints + " pk points and "
                            + killerz.killcount + " kills!";
                }
            }
        }
        deathcount = +1;
    }
}[/code]

i put this after:

public void robfail() { EntangleDelay = 10; }
